meanings.definition: The act of transferring something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The transferals of goods from the warehouse to the store were done efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The company's transferals of employees to different branches helped improve communication.
meanings.sent3: The transferals of snacks from the pantry to the classroom made the students very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her transferals of knowledge from books to her students' minds were like planting seeds of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The transferals of colorful balloons from the party to the park created a beautiful scene.

meanings.definition: The process of moving ownership or control of something to another person or entity.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer handled the legal transferals of property smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The transferals of company shares to new investors required careful documentation.
meanings.sent3: The transferals of pet ownership from one family to another can be emotional.
meanings.sent4: The transferals of power from the king to the council changed the dynamics of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The transferals of responsibility from the manager to the team members were well organized.
